physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of soldiers in uniform. They are all standing with solemn expressions, facing towards the left. The photograph has several deep creases, with some folds along the corners, especially the bottom-left corner. There are some tears along the bottom of the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Soldiers standing solemnly
subject_terms_1: world wars wreaths (visual works) memorial services soldiers
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Photography Wreaths Memorials Soldiers
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
